bibl.title: Letter from Sylvanus Griswold Morley to Laura Armistead Carter, September 17, 1926

div1.p: Griswold sends Carter three new entries from the book of Chilan Balam of Tizimin regarding the illness brought to the Americas by the Spaniards and states that Henry Rose Carter did not see these references.

div1.head: Letter from Sylvanus Griswold Morley to Laura Armistead Carter, September 17, 1926
div1.opener:
Morley, Enclosing span. translation of 3 new entries from
the book of Chilan Balam of Tizimin (in re vómito(s) de sangre.
Book
(Morley) (Maya)
Copy.
Carnegie Institution of Washington.
The Chichen-Itza Project,
Middle American Archaeological Research.
Museum of New Mexico,
Santa Fe, New Mexico,
September 17, 1926.
Miss Laura Carter etc.
div1.p:
Now as to your Father's book. I quote herewith 3 new entries from
the book of Chilan Balam of Tizimin which I know he did not see. While
they do not state that the vómito negro arrived with the Spaniards, that
would seem to be the implication. I quote the paragraphs which mention
the matter at the end of this letter.
We had a most successful year at Chichen Itzá, etc. ****
